titles.title: Vietnam Trade Waiver Disapproval resolution
Disapproving the extension of the waiver authority contained in section 402(c) of the Trade Act of 1974 with respect to Vietnam.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee Adversely by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported Adversely by Voice Vote.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Mr. Solomon asked unanimous consent That it be in order at any time on the legislative day of Thursday, July 30, 1998, to consider in the House the joint resolution, H.J. Res.120, disapproving the extension of the waiver authority contained in section 402(c) of the Trade Act of 1974 with respect to Vietnam; that the joint resolution be considered as read for amendment; that all points of order against the joint resolution and against its consideration be waived; and that the joint resolution be debatable for one hour equally divided and controlled. Agreed to without objection.
Reported adversely by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 105-653.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 367.

action.text: Consideration initiated by previous order of the House.
Considered by previous order of the House.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to a previous order of the House.

vote.text: On passage Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 163 - 260 (Roll No. 356).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

term.name: Civil rights and liberties, minority issues

bill.summary: 6/4/1998--Introduced. Disapproves the recommendation of the President to extend the authority to waive freedom of emigration requirements with respect to Vietnam in order to qualify its products for nondiscriminatory treatment (most-favored-nation treatment).
